projects.title: Mobile Top-Up Service
projects.description:
One of my oldest projects and the one I am most proud of. A full-stack project from setting up its VPS to the 5 different user-facing front-end platforms: SMS, Chatbot, Interactive Voice Menus, App and more. It has evolved from its monolitic back-end to a full API-based architecture.

Wishlist: convert its architecture into microservices leveraging containers.

projects.title: E-commerce
projects.description: Migration of a whole online catalogue and closed-source POS system to an Open Source E-Commerce platform. Working together with credit card payments Gateway to develope in-house OpenCart plugins for transparent credit card operations with local banks.

projects.title: Attendance and Telephone Switching Management
projects.description:
One of my most complex projects and the most scary to migrate. A stack of Biometric SDKs working over Wine, under SeLinux, over a virtualized CentOS on Hyper-V accessing an old Access DB over a Windows Network. But... IT WORKS (oh my god, why).

Such complexity extends to the State Machines needed to manage a custom attendance keeping designs that handles departments, external workers, work leaves, overtimes, holidays, and all related considerations for correct time keeping.

projects.title: Social Improvement Works
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
